intro: Stenospermation popayanense, commonly known as the Popayán stenospermation, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, showy flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
